ygData.subject: Re: Arise creatures of the night.
ygData.msgSnippet: Saurus motioned to his energon knife. Just then Nightmenace broke free and lauched at them. Saurus jumped back, but still got a gash in his chest. Menace s paw

Saurus motioned to his energon knife. Just then Nightmenace broke free 
and lauched at them. Saurus jumped back, but still got a gash in his 
chest. Menace's paw touched a silver amulet around his neck. He let 
out a yelp of pain and ran westward at break neck speed. Saurus fell 
on the ground fighting to stay concious.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Not a very smart protohuman if he didn't migrate when this part of 
the world
> froze.
> 
> Veratis looked down on the little person in front of him, "And just 
how
> would you carry out your threats if I drained the plasma from your 
system?"
> (Direct the gust of wind from Veratis' wings at the human too.)
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <dewboy30816@y...>
> To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> Sent: Saturday, November 24, 2001 11:24 AM
> Subject: Re: Arise creatures of the night.
> 
> 
> > OOC: The rule that cannot be broken can be bent. I'm going to bend 
the
> > no proto humans rule.
> >
> > BIC: Suddenly a proto human runs up to Veratis and sticks an 
energon
> > blade at his chest.
> >
> > Proto Human: I am Saurus Conna, the Death Bringer in my tounge. 
You
> > are a demon sorceror, a demon who breeds more of his own kind. 
Give me
> > such powers to destroy you all and you can live....for now.
> >
> > OOC: Use your imagination if you agree. Just don't do anything as
> > cliche as replacing his arms and legs with robotic parts. If your
> > scientifically precise imagination can't do it just inject him 
with
> > lead or some other  metal, followed by uranium radiation, and some
> > energon radiation and see if you don't get something technorganic 
(you
> > can describe the qualities he attains and LN don't criticize until 
you
> > discuss it with the council I want a char fighting who represents 
the
> > ideals of the proto humans).
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., dewboy30816@y... wrote:
> > > Nightmenace (someone told me Nightmare was taken) heard Veratis, 
but
> > > unlike DAydreamer wasn't sentient. He just continued struggling
> > > unaware of what he had been offered.
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > OOC, I guess Veratis' abilities shocked you, I guess I 
should've
> > > mentioned
> > > > that the first name I thought of for him was FERATU as in
> > Nasferatu.
> > > >
> > > > BIC- Veratis landed out of Nightmenace's reach, "You wish to
> > attack
> > > the very
> > > > bot who offered you sanctuary?" the old scientist grinned once
> > more
> > > not
> > > > surprised by how easily he'd gained control of his opponent. 
"You
> > > will
> > > > either behave or be forced to behave, I leave the choice to 
you."
> > > The half
> > > > bat creature kept eye contact toying with the former free will
> > that
> > > the
> > > > monster had exhibited.
> > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > From: <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > Sent: Thursday, November 22, 2001 4:51 AM
> > > > Subject: Re: Arise creatures of the night.
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > > The werewolf was shocked by the reverse of what was suppose 
to
> > > happen
> > > > > (Veratis was suppose to be frozen in place the only catch 
being
> > > that
> > > > > Nightmenace had to stay perfectly still while he sucked out 
his
> > > sparks
> > > > > energy). He couldn't believe he was restrained. Virtually 
any
> > > material
> > > > > bond he could shatter in seconds, but his intellegence MIGHT
> > equal
> > > > > that of a gorrila or spider monkey, never a chimp or human. 
He
> > > > > struggled seeing a rock 3 feet around he could launch up at
> > > Veratis,
> > > > > but couldn't reach it.
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > > Veratis stared down at his adversary, "A lycanthropic
> > > cybertronian?
> > > > > truly
> > > > > > remarkable." he noticed the stare and decided to show 
exactly
> > > what
> > > > > the beast
> > > > > > was dealing with. Thier eyes met, A hypnotic gaze was sent
> > > toward
> > > > > the
> > > > > > werewolf, The old bot had supressed his nature for to 
long, he
> > > was
> > > > > hungry
> > > > > > for more than the adjusted energeon in his chamber could
> > > provide.
> > > > > This time
> > > > > > he was out for the real thing.
> > > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > > From: <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > > > Sent: Tuesday, November 20, 2001 2:05 PM
> > > > > > Subject: Re: Arise creatures of the night.
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > > Nightmare roared up at the creature. His ears hurt, but 
only
> > > > > certain
> > > > > > > weapons could do a decent amount of damage to him so it
> > wasn't
> > > as
> > > > > bad
> > > > > > > as you might expect. He tried to get a look at Veratis's
> > eyes.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > OOC: I got the computer problems fixed. Before I could 
only
> > > get on
> > > > > at
> > > > > > > school. This has to do with a weapon Hugar hasn't 
responded
> > to
> > > me
> > > > > > > about 3 times so I'm just going to go ahead.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> 
wrote:
> > > > > > > > Veratis heard the creatures battlecry and transformed 
to
> > his
> > > > > half
> > > > > > > bat mode.
> > > > > > > > Nightmare was quick and powerful, There was no doubt. 
The
> > > half
> > > > > bat
> > > > > > > flew
> > > > > > > > skyward screetching an ear splitting tone down towards 
his
> > > > > opponent.
> > > > > > > The old
> > > > > > > > scientist had been caught by surprise but experience 
had
> > > given
> > > > > him a
> > > > > > > few
> > > > > > > > tricks of his own to play with.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > > > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > > > > > Sent: Tuesday, November 20, 2001 8:40 AM
> > > > > > > > Subject: Re: Veratis's Problem
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Daydream begins to follow, but then the sun sets. An
> > > > > > > > > overwhelming pain overcomes his very core. He is no
> > > > > > > > > longer Daydream. In fact he's loosing his 
sentenence.
> > > > > > > > > He has just enough for a few words before loosing it
> > > > > > > > > completely.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Bot: NIGHTMARE BEAST MODE!
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > He transforms into a raging werewolf and charges at
> > > > > > > > > Veratis.
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > --- CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > Veratis saw the look of pain on Daydreams face as 
he
> > > > > > > > > > tried to transform.
> > > > > > > > > > "Perhaps I should take a look at that before we 
get
> > > > > > > > > > started." the scientist
> > > > > > > > > > withdrew a scanner from his side and waved his arm
> > > > > > > > > > forward. A drone floated
> > > > > > > > > > forward and a probe slid out of one of it's 
gripper
> > > > > > > > > > claws.
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > "It would seem you have a malfunction in your
> > > > > > > > > > transforming cog." he said
> > > > > > > > > > recording the bots DNA signature. "Replacing it
> > > > > > > > > > would be a very short, quick
> > > > > > > > > > procedure if you would like to have it fixxed." 
Even
> > > > > > > > > > though it was just a
> > > > > > > > > > minor problem he knew that the bot had no reason 
to
> > > > > > > > > > trust him. "Think about
> > > > > > > > > > it and we'll decide back at my home." The old
> > > > > > > > > > scientist turned and started
> > > > > > > > > > walking back toward his ship. The drones continued
> > > > > > > > > > scanning the area for any
> > > > > > > > > > parasites, radiation, contamination that the pods
> > > > > > > > > > decent might have left
> > > > > > > > > > behind. "You may follow if you wish." Veratis
> > > > > > > > > > started walking towards home
> > > > > > > > > > hopeing the new bot would follow.
> > > > > > > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > > > > > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>
> > > > > > > > > > Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2001 11:58 AM
> > > > > > > > > > Subject: Re: Veratis's Problem
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > Bot: Yes, it is getting late.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > He motions to the setting sun.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > Bot: By the way my name's Daydream. Huh I wonder
> > > > > > > > > > what
> > > > > > > > > > > my Beast mode is it doesn't seem to be in my
> > > > > > > > > > memory
> > > > > > > > > > > banks. Beast mode.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > He jerks forward in pain.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > Daydream: I guess I'll never know.
> > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > --- CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > Veratis arives nearby and scans the new bot
> > > > > > > > > > useing
> > > > > > > > > > > > his batlike sonar as a
> > > > > > > > > > > > carrier wave. the arctic snow coated both bots
> > > > > > > > > > in a
> > > > > > > > > > > > thin layer of white like
> > > > > > > > > > > > a thin cold blanket. The old scientist sized 
up
> > > > > > > > > > the
> > > > > > > > > > > > other bot and sensed a
> > > > > > > > > > > > nonthreatening attitude from the newcomer.
> > > > > > > > > > Stepping
> > > > > > > > > > > > forward the scientist
> > > > > > > > > > > > wrapped his wings around himself causeing them
> > > > > > > > > > to
> > > > > > > > > > > > resemble a cloak. His hand
> > > > > > > > > > > > grasped his speargun beneath in case of
> > > > > > > > > > emergency
> > > > > > > > > > > > and the drones hovered
> > > > > > > > > > > > close remaining slightly behind thier master
> > > > > > > > > > > > awaiting his instructions.
> > > > > > > > > > > > "Greetings," Veratis said calmly, "My name is
> > > > > > > > > > > > Veratis. I invite you into my
> > > > > > > > > > > > home to rest for as long as need be as my
> > > > > > > > > > guest."
> > > > > > > > > > > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > > > > > > > > > > From: Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > > > > > > > > To: <nbwrpg@y...>

walks

> > > > > > > > > > > > to
> > > > > > > > > > > > > it. The dna scanners come online and scan 
the
> > > > > > > > > > > > > protohuman, who runs off screaming. A bot
> > > > > > > > > > tall(9
> > > > > > > > > > > > ft.),
> > > > > > > > > > > > > blueish bot comes out.
> > > > > > > > > > > > >

> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Veratis' scanners alert him to the 
incoming
> > > > > > > > > > pod.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > "Ah, another bot for me to
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > save from the wages of war." It was still 
to
> > > > > > > > > > > > early
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > to tell if it was a
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > Maximal or Predacon chip inside but the 
old

> > > > > > > > > > > > > > those sorts of things. "I guess I'll have 
to
> > > > > > > > > > > > take a
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > short trip to greet our
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > new guest." The old bot set the scanners 
on
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > automatic record and set off to
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > the north accompanied by three of his
> > > > > > > > > > drones,
> > > > > > > > > > > > one of
